poem:
Title: "Stand-Up on Society's Set"

A performance, on life's unruly stage,
Novellie's voice, a pen's searing light.
Laughter crafted from unheard rage,
An autistic prism splitting night.
"Sounding like me", echoes the quiet heckle,
Reflecting a shared, silent battle.
In laughter's mirror, we subtly connect,
Finding solace in life's awkward spectacles.
Unseen threads, our narratives intersect,
Turned comedy, such shared spectacles.
